data.event: Mansfield was incorporated in October 1702 from the Town of Windham, in Hartford County.
When Windham County was formed on 12 May 1726, Mansfield then became part of that county.
A century later, at a town meeting on 3 April 1826, selectmen voted to ask the General Assembly to annex Mansfield to Tolland County.
Though nothing remains of the mill (now on display at the Henry Ford Museum in Detroit, Michigan), Mansfield has held onto several other historic landmarks.
There are tours available May through October.
